tweet: Tune in to WCVB “On The Record” today at 11am - I join Ed Harding and Janet Wu to discuss topics such as the 2020 elections, protecting our election security, the safety of our Commuter Rail and of course, the OTR pop quiz.
The SAFE Act takes a critical step toward securing our election infrastructure and making sure that every vote is counted.

I am proud to see H.R. 2722, Securing America’s Federal Elections (SAFE) Act, pass the House. Since we know that foreign governments continue to target our 2020 national elections it is important we provide the necessary funding for states to update & secure their voting systems.
It’s important to take the necessary actions to guarantee the safety of all travelers.  https://www.facebook.com/repstephenlynch/videos/1281193035372126/ …

From June 1st to Labor Day we are predicting to see 257 million passengers flying to and from U.S. airports while we continue to battle failures in our passenger screening process, long lines & high turnover among low-paid Transportation Security Officers.  https://www.facebook.com/repstephenlynch/videos/1281193035372126/ …

This week @OversightDems held a hearing on “Identifying, Resolving & Preventing Vulnerabilities in TSA’s Security Operations” to examine why urgent warnings from auditors about security vulnerabilities at our airports have been deteriorating for years without being resolved.

This vote to issue a subpoena to Kellyanne Conway was not about theatrics or politics – it was about abiding by the rule of law and holding Ms. Conway accountable for her behavior.  https://www.facebook.com/repstephenlynch/videos/456408991596591/ …

This same law and its penalties were applied against Obama cabinet officials, and Ms. Conway has been warned repeatedly but has refused to comply with the law. We asked Ms. Conway to voluntarily come to Congress and explain her behavior and she refused.  https://www.facebook.com/repstephenlynch/videos/456408991596591/ …

Today I am wearing the Pride ribbon in honor of the 49 #LGBTQ lives that were taken at the Orlando #Pulse Nightclub 3 years ago.  As we honor the victims, we must also demonstrate our commitment to fight against any form of violence, bigotry and hatred in our country.

The White House has refused to comply with congressional subpoenas in an attempt to conceal the truth from the American people. H.Res.430 will allow oversight to be properly conducted to ensure that no one is above the law. #ForThePeople
H.Res.430 further provides all committee chairs with authority to go directly to court to enforce their own subpoenas without the necessity of a full House vote.

Yesterday the House passed H.Res.430, the Civil Contempt and Subpoena Enforcement Resolution, authorizing the Judiciary Committee to initiate or intervene in judicial proceedings to enforce certain subpoenas.

As an original cosponsor, I am proud to join over 300 of my House colleagues in support of this bipartisan legislation to ensure the heroes and survivors of 9/11 receive the awards and protections they deserve. #Renew911VCF
Today @HouseJudiciary held a hearing on H.R. 1327, the Never Forget The Heroes Act, to renew and effectively make permanent the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund. #Renew911VCF
